title: Wolves close out Warriors for 2nd straight WCF
content: The Timberwolves are back in the Western Conference finals for the second straight year after closing out the Warriors with a 121-110 win in Game 5 on Wednesday night.

title: Eagles-Chiefs rematch in W2 as NFL sked unveiled

title: Johnson's Bears debut vs. Vikes opens MNF slate

title: Refocused Celtics lean on D, Kornet to stay alive
content: The Celtics used a reinvigorated defense and the unlikely breakout of backup big man Luke Kornet to keep their season alive and send this playoff series against the Knicks back to New York for Game 6 on Friday.

title: Kapanen's OT winner propels Oilers to West finals
content: Kasperi Kapanen scored on a scramble in front of the net at 7:14 of overtime, and the Edmonton Oilers beat the Vegas Golden Knights 1-0 in Game 5 on Wednesday night to advance to the Western Conference finals for the second year in a row.

title: Reds celebrate Rose day after MLB reinstatement
content: Pete Rose was honored by the Reds on Wednesday night, a day after he was posthumously removed from MLB's permanent ineligibility list.

title: Sasaki unsure if velocity dip tied to shoulder issue
content: Roki Sasaki, who is on the injured list with a shoulder impingement, said he isn't sure if the injury is the main reason for an alarming dip in his fastball's velocity.

title: Madrid's Asencio may be charged for explicit video

content: The 2025 NFL schedule was released Wednesday, prompting unique reveals by multiple teams on social media.

title: Sources: Man City eye Wirtz as Liverpool look on
content: Manchester City are pushing to sign Florian Wirtz but face stiff competition from Bayern Munich, a source has told ESPN.

title: NWSL players call for changes after King collapse
content: The NWSL Players Association said that play should have been stopped in the game between Angel City FC and the Utah Royals on Friday following the nearly 10-minute delay to provide medical attention to Savy King.

title: Bologna win Coppa Italia as Pulisic, Milan fall short
content: Dan Ndoye's second-half strike earned Bologna a hard-fought 1-0 victory over AC Milan in the Coppa Italia final on Wednesday to secure their first major trophy in 51 years.

title: Tottenham's Son files blackmail complaint in Seoul
content: Tottenham Hotspur captain Son Heung-min has filed a complaint to South Korean police alleging he was the victim of a blackmail attempt, his agency said on Thursday, after media reports that a woman had threatened him with a false pregnancy claim.

content: The suspect, Nauman Ilahi (24), is from Kairana in Uttar Pradesh, who had been working as a private security guard in the district, the police said on Wednesday (May 14, 2025).

title: Farmers’ income doubled whenever TDP is in power, says Naidu
content: Target for livestock sector for 2025–26 is set at ₹1.95 lakh crore; it is also targeted to double the horticulture area to 36 lakh hectares from existing 18 lakh hectares

title: Bengal taps into ‘concert economy’ with new 25-acre tech-entertainment park in New Town
content: “The concept of a concert economy is an innovative idea. We have the infrastructure here… Here, we can host international-level cultural events,” the Chief Minister announced

title: "Go And Apologise": Top Court To Minister Over Colonel Sofiya Qureshi Remark
content: The Supreme Court today sharply rebuked Madhya Pradesh minister Vijay Shah over his controversial remarks directed at Indian Army officer Colonel Sofiya Qureshi.

title: Indian Astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla To Fly To Space From Same Launch Complex As Neil Armstrong
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla is scheduled to pilot the Axiom Mission 4, a private astronaut mission that will launch aboard a SpaceX Dragon capsule on a Falcon 9 rocket.

title: YouTuber MrBeast In Trouble Over Ancient Mexican Temple Video. Here's Why
content: MrBeast, the world's most subscribed YouTuber, is in trouble again, this time with the Mexican authorities over a video shot at multiple federally protected archaeological sites such as Calakmul, Chichen Itza & Balamcanche.

title: Video: Huge Fire Erupts At Delhi College, 11 Fire Engines At Spot
content: Visuals showed a raging fire with a huge amount of smoke coming out of the windows of the university.

title: India's 6-Point Rebuttal To US On Every Pakistan Ceasefire Claim
content: India on Tuesday issued a six-point rebuttal to recent statements by US President Donald Trump and senior members of his administration regarding the India-Pakistan ceasefire agreement announced over the weekend.

title: "Can Timelines Be Imposed?" President's Big Question To Supreme Court
content: A month after the Supreme Court's landmark verdict in the Tamil Nadu case, which effectively set a deadline for the President and Governors to clear Bills passed by the legislature, President Droupadi Murmu has written to the top court

title: No Group Issued Threat Against Manipur's Shirui Lily Festival: Police
content: The Manipur Police said they found no organisation called 'Kuki Zo Village Volunteer - Eastern Zone' (KZVV-EZ) that allegedly threatened members of the Meitei community against passing by Kuki villages while going Ukhrul for Shirui Lily Festival.

title: D Gukesh To Ananya Panday: India's Brightest On Forbes 30 Under 30 2025
content: India dominated the Forbes 30 Under 30 2025 list with 94 honorees, the most from any country in the Asia-Pacific region.

title: Moments Before Mexican Influencer Was Shot Dead During TikTok Livestream
content: A Mexican social media influencer was shot dead while live-streaming on TikTok. Valeria Marquez, 23, was murdered by a man who entered her beauty salon in Guadalajara city of Mexico's Jalisco, on the pretext of delivering a gift before opening fire.

title: "Indians Shouldn't Take Trump Literally": Ex-US Official On Ceasefire
content: Michael Rubin, a former Pentagon official and senior fellow at the American Enterprise Institute, took a jibe at US President Donald Trump's tendency to claim credit for almost every achievement.

title: "Pakistan Ran Like A Scared Dog With Tail Between Its Legs": Ex-US Official
content: A former Pentagon official, Michael Rubin has said that India targeted terror infrastructure with precision, and it was able to blunt Pakistan's response following the recent strikes.

title: Pakistan "Pleads" With India To Reconsider Indus Waters Treaty Suspension
content: Pakistan has reportedly written a letter to India, urging it to reconsider the decision to put the Indus Waters Treaty into abeyance.

title: NDTV Exclusive: India Fighting Twin Wars - On Ground And Online
content: Since May 7, the day of India's strategic strike across the border, an advanced Command Center was established within the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting.

title: "Young, Attractive Guy": Trump's Big Praise For Terrorist-Turned-President
content: Dismantling years of US government policy of treating Syria like a pariah, President Donald Trump on Wednesday met Syrias interim president, Ahmad al-Sharaa.

title: Muslim Man Can Have Multiple Wives If He Treats All Of Them Equally: Court
content: A single bench of Justice Arun Kumar Singh Deswal made the remarks while hearing a petition to quash the chargesheet, cognisance, and summons order against a man, Furkan, issued by a court in Moradabad.

title: Watch: British MP Bob Blackman Calls For Action Against Terror Bases In PoK
content: British MP Bob Blackman has condemned the terrorist attack in Jammu and Kashmirs Pahalgam, which claimed 26 lives, mostly tourists.

title: "They're Killing Poor Kids": Ben & Jerry's Founder Arrested From US Senate
content: Ben Cohen, cofounder of Ben &Jerry's ice cream and a longtime progressive activist, told AFP he was speaking for millions of Americans outraged by the "slaughter" in Gaza after his removal from a US Senate hearing on Wednesday.

title: Karnataka Cops Arrest 12 Over Online Jobs Scam
content: Twelve men have been arrested for cheating people online, extorting money from them with the promise of jobs.

title: How Trump's Syria Announcement Shocked US Allies, White House Officials
content: When President Donald Trump announced in Saudi Arabia on Tuesday that he would lift all sanctions on Syria, the decision - which will boost a country devastated by 13 years of war - took many in the region by surprise.

title: Tillman puts PSV on title brink as Ajax collapse
content: Ajax Amsterdam relinquished top spot in the Dutch league to PSV Eindhoven on the penultimate match day on Wednesday after they were held to a 2-2 draw following a late equaliser by Groningen.

title: Winless Galaxy squander lead, lose 10th of season
content: Tai Baribo scored two goals, including the game winner in the sixth minute of second-half stoppage time, as the Philadelphia Union rallied for a 3-2 victory Wednesday while keeping the Los Angeles Galaxy winless on the season.

title: MLS bans Rosales 3 games for discrimination
content: Minnesota United midfielder Joseph Rosales received a three-game ban from Major League Soccer after being found to have violated the MLS-MLSPA Joint Non-Discrimination Policy.

title: The UFC 317 and 319 title fights have big implications for the future
content: Pound-for-pound mainstays litter the main cards of UFC 317 and UFC 319, which means action is on the docket for sure.

content: What to know as Formula 1 heads to Imola at Autodromo Internazionale Enzo e Dino Ferrari for round seven of the 2025 season.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal, Liverpool and Chelsea eye João Pedro
content: Arsenal, Liverpool and Chelsea all have their eyes on João Pedro as a summer target. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Bengaluru: OC mandatory for utility connections; BBMP to check documents for new connections
content: Supreme Court direction states that ‘utilities such as electricity, water supply, and sanitation connections are to be provided only to buildings that have obtained an Occupancy Certificate/Completion Certificate from the respective local authority’

title: BEML flags off 2,100th metro coach in Bengaluru, to set up new unit in Madhya Pradesh
content: The new unit will be developed on 60.063 hectares of land allocated by the Madhya Pradesh government.

title: Indian team to present in U.N. evidence on Pahalgam terror attack
content: India has accused The Resistance Front of carrying out the April 22 attack and the meeting with the Monitoring Team will be the first step towards getting the TRF banned

title: India ‘pushing back’ Bangladeshis held without documents
content: According to a government official, as many as 295 Bangladeshis were “deported” in 2024, and this year till April 30, around 100 Bangladeshi citizens have been deported and handed over to the Border Guards Bangladesh

content: Mukesh Ambani was also present when Donald Trump visited India last as the U.S. President in February 2020

title: Trinamool to hold rallies to honour soldiers who laid down their lives in India-Pakistan conflict
content: West Bengal CM and Trinamool Congress chairperson Mamata Banerjee, who had extended full support to the Union government in Operation Sindoor, said that she does not see organising events to pay respects to armed forces as a political move.

title: Railway Ministry replaces 'mentally retarded' with 'intellectual disability' in concession forms
content: Railway Ministry replaces offensive terms with inclusive language in concession forms for persons with disabilities

title: Opposition should ‘shed politics’ at least till Operation Sindoor ends, says BJP
content: The issue of Pakistan occupied Kashmir is a bilateral issue to be settled between India and Pakistan, BJP spokesperson Sudhanshu Trivedi said

title: Odisha introduces 11.25% reservation for SEBC students in higher education
content: State Cabinet approves reservation in public universities and colleges from 2025–26 academic session; move seeks to enhance access and equity in line with NEP 2020

title: J&K CM Omar Abdullah promises to build more bunkers for border residents
content: The Chief Minister said more individual bunkers will be built in all shelling-affected regions; Centre built 7,923 bunkers in the vulnerable border districts of the Jammu division

title: Himalayan leap for yak genomic science
content: The first-ever chromosome-level genome of the Indian yak was assembled by specialists from four ICAR institutions

title: Operation Sindoor: Indigenous weapon systems highly effective, says Centre
content: ‘All offensive strikes on Pakistan military targets were executed without loss of Indian assets, underscoring the effectiveness of our surveillance, planning, and delivery systems’, says Press Information Bureau

title: People from other faiths prayed for me, says Assam pastor absolved of ‘magic healing’ charges
content: Pranjal Bhuyan said his arrest under the Assam Healing (Prevention of Evil) Practices Act underscores the need for its careful implementation

title: Delay in convicted BJP MLA’s disqualification upsets Opposition in Rajasthan
content: Congress seeks Governor’s intervention as BJP MLA faces disqualification under RP Act; Speaker’s delay draws flak amidst constitutional debate

title: Take steps to ensure proper footpaths, Supreme Court tells States
content: Court says clear, unimpeded footpaths a fundamental right of pedestrians; Bench says that in the absence of footpaths, pedestrians are forced to walk on roads, making them vulnerable to accidents

title: City NGO committed to preserving Chittara folk art of Malnad’s Deevaru community
content: This folk art involves intricate geometric patterns painted on walls, trays, bamboo or fibre baskets, and is deeply ingrained in the Deevara community’s culture and traditions

title: Two red sanders smugglers nabbed in Kadapa, 9 logs recovered
content: During operations, the teams spotted a motorcycle at a remote location. As they approached, two men tried to flee but were quickly apprehended

title: Miss World 2025 contestants serenade around Ramappa Temple in saris
content: Dressed in multi-hued saris, 35 contestants greeted with customary foot-washing before entering temple complex; witness dance show dedicated to Queen Rudrama Devi of Kakatiya dynasty

title: Police action against anti-war rally in Thrissur sparks outrage
content: Rally, organised by the People’s Anti-War Front, was blocked by the police and several activists were taken into preventive custody

title: Maharashtra cine-employees’ body appeals for boycott of Turkey for film shoots
content: Cine workers’ body appeals to Indian filmmakers to avoid Turkey and Azerbaijan as shooting locations; receives backing from major producers’ associations

title: PACE Institute signs MoU with Malaysian university UTeM to boost academic collaboration
content: The MoU represents a strategic alliance to promote academic exchange, joint research, and technological collaboration between both institutions

title: Karnataka government considers freezing enhancement of Computer Science engineering seats
content: Aims is to prevent mushrooming of private engineering colleges in tier-1 cities and unemployment in the future

title: A.P. students achieve 95.36 per cent pass rate in POLYCET-2025
content: 19 students secure a perfect score of 120 out of 120 marks; girls outperform the boys with a pass percentage of 96.9 compared to 94.38 by the latter

title: Olympian Neeraj Chopra conferred honorary rank of Lt. Col. in Territorial Army
content: Neeraj Chopra, Olympic gold medallist, awarded honorary Lieutenant Colonel rank in Territorial Army by Government notification

title: Funding for Centrally sponsored schemes declining: Karnataka CM
content: As against the mandated release of ₹22,758 crore, the Union government released only ₹18,562 crore to the State during 2024-25, says Siddaramaiah

title: Complete Budameru retaining wall works before June 10, Nimmala tells officials
content: Deploy additional machinery and resources for timely completion and proposals have been prepared to expand the Budameru Diversion Canal’s capacity to 37,500 cusecs, says Water Resources Department Minister

title: ‘Viswaroopa Darshan’ brings curtains on Tirupati Gangamma Jatara
content: According to tradition, it is believed that the eyes of the goddess are so powerful that her focused gaze could burn down an entire area

title: Plus One admissions: 84,225 applications received on first day
content: Applications can be submitted till 5 p.m. on May 20. More than 1 lakh candidate logins have been created

title: 'Exercise restraint': SC slams minister for 'irresponsible' remarks on Col. Sofiya Qureshi
content: The Supreme Court reprimanded Madhya Pradesh minister Vijay Shah for his "irresponsible" remarks about Colonel Sofiya Qureshi, emphasizing that individuals in constitutional roles must exercise caution, especially during sensitive operations like Operation Sindoor. Shah's comments, suggesting the Prime Minister sent a "terrorists' sister" to harm them, led to widespread condemnation and a High Court order for an FIR against him.

title: Pak went running to try to achieve ceasefire like scared dog: Ex-Pentagon official
content: Michael Rubin stated that Pakistan hastily sought a ceasefire after India effectively countered its missile and drone attacks. He highlighted India's precise strikes on terror infrastructure within Pakistan and PoK, which successfully neutralized Pakistan's retaliatory efforts. Rubin emphasized that India's diplomatic victory lies in shifting global focus onto Pakistan's support for terrorism, exposing the deep ties between the Pakistani military and terrorist organizations.

title: Muslim man allowed to have multiple wives if he can treat them equally: Allahabad HC
content: The Allahabad High Court has stated that Muslim men can marry more than once if they treat all wives equally, referencing Quranic permission for polygamy under specific conditions. This ruling came during a case involving Furkan, accused of bigamy and rape for marrying without disclosing his existing wife. The court dismissed the charges, acknowledging Muslim law allows multiple wives, and ordered further investigation while protecting Furkan from coercive action.

title: 'We've lost trust in men': Deceived by husbands, 2 UP women ‘marry’ each other
content: In Bareilly, two women, Asha (Golu) and Jyoti, both deceived about their husbands' religious identities, have forged an unconventional bond. Estranged from family and societal norms, they found solace in shared experiences and decided to "marry" in a temple ceremony.

title: IPL 2025 playoffs scenarios explained: Who needs to do what to qualify
content: Following a brief interruption, the IPL is set to resume on May 17, with Mumbai Indians, Delhi Capitals, Kolkata Knight Riders and Lucknow Super Giants vying for the final playoff spot. MI and DC are in a strong position, while KKR and LSG face an uphill battle. Chennai Super Kings, Rajasthan Royals, and Sunrisers Hyderabad have been eliminated from contention.

title: After Message to Pakistanis, what Ranveer Allahbadia said on Piers Morgan show
content: YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia faced backlash for a peace message to Pakistanis, which he quickly deleted. He then appeared on Piers Morgan's show, confronting Pakistani panelists with evidence of Bin Laden's proximity to a Pakistani military base and a UN-designated terrorist being honored by the Pakistani military.

title: Bangladesh to get $1.3bn from IMF; seeks $762m augmentation in support
content: Bangladesh has requested an additional $762 million from the IMF, potentially increasing total assistance to $4.1 billion. This request comes as the nation faces macroeconomic challenges, including slowed GDP growth and persistent inflation. The IMF's support is contingent upon Bangladesh undertaking critical reforms, such as exchange rate liberalization and tax improvements, to ensure financial stability.

title: With ‘special troops train’, govt signals J&K plan’s on track
content: Indian Railways successfully conducted a trial run of a special train on the Katra-Qazigund section. This section includes the Chenab Bridge. The train carried soldiers and completed a round trip with full security. This trial is significant due to the ongoing Indo-Pak conflict. The new rail line will improve connectivity to Kashmir.

title: Amazon cuts more jobs: 'As part of our ongoing work to make our teams ...
content: Amazon has reportedly laid off 100 employees from its Devices and Services division, responsible for popular products like Echo and Ring. The company cites efficiency improvements and alignment with its product roadmap as reasons. CEO Andy Jassy is focused on cutting bureaucracy and rewarding employees who achieve more with fewer resources.

title: Fire breaks out at Sri Guru Gobind Singh College of Commerce in Delhi
content: A fire broke out on Thursday morning at Sri Guru Gobind Singh College of Commerce in Delhi's Pitampura. The blaze, which started in the library, was brought under control around 9:40 am after 11 fire tenders were deployed. No casualties were reported.

title: ‘Main bol raha hoon’: BSF jawan's first call home melts wife’s heart
content: BSF Jawan Purnam Shaw returned to India after 22 days in Pakistan custody, bringing immense relief to his family in Kolkata. His wife, Rajni, confirmed his identity through a phone call and shared the news with their son. West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee assured Rajni of Purnam's well-being and expressed her desire to meet him upon his return.

title: After Musk’s Starlink, Amazon eyes India's satellite internet space
content: Amazon's Project Kuiper, under Jeff Bezos, is vying for entry into India's satellite internet market, seeking DoT approval amidst competition from Bharti-backed Eutelsat OneWeb and Reliance Jio-SES JV. Kuiper plans a substantial infrastructure with ten gateways and two presence points, aiming for commercial launch later this year after recent satellite launches.

title: Melinda Gates on when she realised its time to end marriage with Bill Gates
content: Melinda French Gates revealed a recurring dream of standing on a crumbling cliff with Bill Gates and their children influenced her decision to divorce. This dream, along with surfacing information like Bill's association with Jeffrey Epstein, served as a catalyst. She also experienced panic attacks during the separation, highlighting the emotional toll of ending their 27-year marriage.

title: England cricketer trolls Babar Azam over contrasting PSL records
content: Sam Billings ignited a playful rivalry with Babar Azam by sharing a post highlighting their contrasting PSL 2025 records. Billings celebrated his blistering 19-ball fifty, the fastest this season, while subtly mocking Babar's slow 47-ball half-century. As the PSL 2025 is set to resume on May 17, all eyes are on how both players respond on the field.

title: Stock market: Nifty50, Sensex volatile in trade, swing between green and red
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, started trade on a choppy note on Thursday. While Nifty50 was near 24,650, BSE Sensex was below 81,300.

title: 'Why, Virat? We all still need you!': Tharoor pays glowing tribute to Kohli
content: Shashi Tharoor expressed his sadness over Virat Kohli's unexpected retirement from Test cricket, calling him "immortal in whites." Tharoor reminisced about their meeting and admired Kohli's Test performances, lamenting the absence of a farewell match. Kohli's exit at 36 marks the end of an era, leaving a void as India prepares for the next World Test Championship cycle.

title: ‘Gutter language’: HC slams BJP minister, orders FIR for remark against Col Qureshi
content: The Madhya Pradesh High Court has taken suo motu cognizance of state minister Vijay Shah's derogatory remarks against Colonel Sofiya Qureshi, ordering the DGP to file an FIR. The court condemned Shah's “gutter language” as disparaging to both the officer and the armed forces.

title: 10 militants killed in gunfight with Assam Rifles in Manipur's Chandel
content: The Army's Eastern Command said in a post on X, "Acting on specific intelligence on movement of armed cadres nearby New Samtal village, Khengjoy Tehsil, Chandel District near the Indo-Myanmar Border, Assam Rifles unit under Spear Corps launched an operation on 14 May 2025."

title: Gold price prediction: Why is Rs 92,000 level critical?
content: Gold and silver price prediction: Gold prices have sharply declined, reaching a critical support level of ₹92,000, a break below which could trigger further selling. Conversely, silver exhibits strength, consolidating between ₹95,300 and ₹97,500.

title: To return or not: Foreign players face dilemma ahead of IPL resumption
content: IPL franchises face disruption as international cricket schedules clash with the league's resumption. South Africa's directive to recall players for the WTC final by May 26th creates challenges, impacting teams like Gujarat Titans and Punjab Kings. England's ODI series against West Indies further complicates matters, potentially affecting teams like Mumbai Indians and Royal Challengers Bengaluru.

title: Sky-high valour: Bihar’s sons at helm of Operation Sindoor
content: Air Marshal Awadesh Kumar Bharti, hailing from Purnia, Bihar, played a crucial role in Operation Sindoor as the DG Air Operations, avenging the Pahalgam killings. Inspired by the establishment of a military airbase in his town after the 1962 war, he excelled in Sainik School and NDA, earning prestigious awards for his service.

title: India meets UN counter-terror officials, pushes for listing of LeT front TRF
content: An Indian delegation met with UN officials to bolster counter-terrorism cooperation following the Pahalgam attack claimed by a Lashkar-e-Taiba front. Discussions revisited commitments from the 2022 Delhi Declaration and addressed threats from unmanned aerial systems and terrorist financing. The meeting occurred amidst heightened tensions and military actions between India and Pakistan after the attack.

title: Festival de Cannes: How to pronounce 'Cannes' correctly
content: As the Cannes Film Festival attracts global attention, mastering the pronunciation of 'Cannes' as 'Kan' is crucial for fashion enthusiasts and film lovers. Correct pronunciation demonstrates cultural awareness and enhances one's presence in elite circles. Mispronouncing it can lead to social faux pas, especially in fashion-conscious environments.

title: 5, including 2 kids, charred to death as double-decker bus catches fire in Lucknow
content: A tragic fire on a Lucknow flyover claimed five lives, including two children, when a private bus carrying 80 passengers caught fire. The bus, en route from Bihar to Delhi, experienced flames erupting for unknown reasons. The driver and conductor reportedly fled, leaving passengers trapped. Rescue operations were launched, and the deceased have been identified as residents of Begusarai, Bihar.

title: Kerala LSS USS scholarship result 2025 declared; download here
content: The Kerala Pareeksha Bhavan has declared the LSS and USS Scholarship Exam Results 2025 on May 14, 2025. Students can check their results at bpekerala.in using their registration number and date of birth. The LSS cut-off is 48 marks, and the USS cut-off is 63 marks. Qualified students must submit verification documents by June 15, 2025. Re-evaluation applications are open until May 31, 2025. The scholarships support academically talented students from Classes 4 and 7.

title: 'Virat Kohli put his heart and soul into Test cricket'
content: Virat Kohli's retirement from Test cricket has drawn widespread acclaim, with legends like Atherton and Hussain lauding his transformative impact. Kohli ended his career with 9,230 runs in 123 Tests. Atherton admired Kohli's passion, while Hussain highlighted his aura and leadership. Kohli's captaincy saw India become the No. 1 Test side for 42 months, marking a fearless era.

title: Can SC fix deadlines for President, governors’ assent to bills?: Murmu
content: President Murmu has sought the Supreme Court's opinion on the validity of its recent verdict that set deadlines for governors and the President to decide on state bills. Questioning the constitutional basis for such timelines, she invoked Article 143(1) to address concerns about the court's overreach and the concept of deemed assent, deeming it alien to the constitutional framework.

title: Top stocks to buy: Recommendations for today
content: Top stock market recommendations: Nuvama Professional Clients Group's Aakash K Hindocha suggests a positive outlook for Nifty and Bank Nifty, setting targets at 24900/25400 and a range of 54500-55900, respectively. Havells, Adani Energy Solutions, and HCL Technologies are top buy recommendations.

title: IAEA says no report of radiation leak from any Pak facility
content: The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) has refuted claims of a radiation leak from any Pakistani nuclear facility, following reports that Indian missiles struck Kirana Hills during Operation Sindoor. This clarification counters widespread social media speculation and foreign media theories. The IAEA confirmed that, based on available information, no radiation release occurred.

title: Pakistan's appeal to India: Rethink suspension of Indus Waters Treaty
content: Pakistan has appealed to India to reconsider its decision to keep the Indus Waters Treaty in abeyance, citing the dependence of millions on the regulated water. India, however, remains firm on its decision, taken in response to terrorist activities, asserting that changed circumstances and Pakistan's actions warrant a reevaluation of the treaty.

title: When Aishwarya broke the internet with purple lipstick at Cannes Film Festival
content: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan's Cannes Film Festival appearances are always a highlight, especially her bold fashion choices. In 2016, her purple lipstick became a viral sensation, sparking both praise and criticism. Amitabh Bachchan defended her look, emphasizing social media's role in self-expression and the fleeting nature of trends. Now, as Cannes 2025 begins, fans eagerly anticipate Aishwarya's next iconic moment.

title: Pak inked deal with crypto company in which Trump kin has 60% stake
content: Donald Trump's renewed interest in mediating between India and Pakistan coincides with a recent deal between Pakistan's Crypto Council and World Liberty Financial (WLF), a cryptocurrency venture with Trump family ties. This partnership, involving figures like Zachary Witkoff, raises questions about potential connections between the crypto deal and Trump's shift in stance on the Indo-Pak conflict.

title: Ax-4, with India’s Shubhanshu Shukla, to liftoff on June 8
content: Axiom Space's Ax-4 mission, piloted by India’s Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, is scheduled to launch to the ISS on June 8. The mission, carried by a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket, will include astronauts from India, Poland, and Hungary, marking a return to human spaceflight for each nation after over four decades.

title: India demonstrated tech edge by beating Pak’s Chinese systems
content: India successfully conducted strikes against terror hubs, bypassing Pakistan's air defenses. The Indian Air Force also thwarted multiple retaliatory missile and drone attacks. Indigenous air defence network played a crucial role during the hostilities. The armed forces are on high alert, maintaining operational readiness. India is adhering to the bilateral understanding to cease military action.

title: Overseas borrowing surges to 5-year high
content: India's private sector is witnessing a surge in investment, with companies securing a record $11 billion in external commercial borrowings (ECBs) in March 2025. This five-year high, driven by confidence in India's economic prospects, saw approvals granted to firms like Foxconn's Yuzhan Technology and JSW Steel. For FY25, total ECB proposals reached $61.

title: ‘Raid 2’ collection: Ajay Devgn’s crime drama mints over Rs 174 crore
content: Ajay Devgn's 'Raid 2' performs well at the box office. The crime drama inches closer to beating Salman Khan’s 'Sikandar' globally. The film earns Rs 133.45 crore in India. Overseas collections reach Rs 19.60 crore. The worldwide total stands at Rs 174.25 crore. 'Raid 2' aims to enter the Rs 150 crore club in India soon.

title: High court fines firm for fraudulent GST tax credit claim
content: The Delhi High Court has raised concerns about the misuse of a Central Goods and Services Tax Act provision, fining a firm for fraudulently claiming input tax credit (ITC) to evade full GST payment. The court highlighted the potential damage to the GST framework from such large-scale fraud involving fake invoices.

title: Judge orders Indian student released from ICE detention
content: A federal judge ordered the release of a Georgetown scholar detained in Texas, citing substantial constitutional claims against the Trump administration regarding free speech. Simultaneously, a Wisconsin judge was indicted for allegedly aiding an undocumented immigrant, while another judge cleared the way for deporting a Venezuelan man under the Alien Enemies Act, requiring due process.

title: Lost it on Wegovy? You might gain it all back in a year
content: A recent study presented at the European Congress on Obesity reveals that individuals using weight loss drugs, including newer GLP-1 medications, tend to regain all lost weight within a year of discontinuing the medication. While these drugs effectively induce weight loss, maintaining a healthy lifestyle through diet and exercise remains crucial for long-term success.

title: Anushka & Virat’s heartwarming family moment with Vamika and Akaay
content: Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli have always stood as one of the most admired celebrity couples, not just for their professional excellence, but also for the genuine bond they share as life partners and parents. Recently, after Virat Kohli announced his retirement from Test cricket, the family sought spiritual peace and blessings at an ashram in Vrindavan. And now, a heartwarming video showing a rare glimpse into their private family time has surfaced online.

title: 21-day ‘biggest-ever op’ leaves 31 Maoists dead
content: Security forces concluded a 21-day anti-Maoist operation in Karreguttalu Hills. Thirty-one Maoist bodies were recovered. The operation scattered the Maoist command. Amit Shah called it the biggest assault on Maoists. Forces faced difficult terrain. They cleared caves housing arms manufacturing units. The operation busted a major Maoist stronghold. Disjointed Maoist formations are taking shelter in different places.

title: It’s time a performance audit of HC judges is done: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has voiced concerns over high court judges frequently taking unnecessary breaks, suggesting a need for performance audits to assess their output relative to expenditure. This observation arose during a case where the Jharkhand HC delayed pronouncing a verdict, prompting the SC to emphasize adherence to judgment timelines and propose a monitoring mechanism.

title: Tata Power to bid for UP discoms in core business push
content: Tata Power will bid for Dakshinanchal Vidyut Vitran Nigam and Purvanchal Vidyut Vitran Nigam in Uttar Pradesh. The company aims to expand its transmission and distribution business. Tata Power currently serves 12.5 million customers and wants to reach 40 million in five years. The company is also awaiting legal clarity on small modular nuclear reactors.

title: Tech glitches disrupt CUET-UG day-2 in conflict-hit J&K, Delhi
content: CUET-UG 2025's second day was marred by technical and logistical failures, impacting over 350 students in J&K and Delhi. Exam cancellations in Srinagar and centre allocation issues in Meghalaya caused significant distress. Students faced challenges like power outages, distant exam centres, and inadequate facilities, raising concerns about the NTA's preparedness and student welfare.

title: MMA pound-for-pound rankings: Who landed in top five, Della Maddalena or Silva?
content: Della Maddalena beats belal Muhammad in the pound-for-pound rankings . the other fighter who earned a spot landed in an even more coveted position in the top 10 . Natalia Silva beat former women's flyweight champion Alexa Grasso . Valentina Shevchenko garnered added support from the voting panel .

title: Will Harrison Jr. break out? Can McConkey be a No. 1? 2nd-year WR questions
content: the 2025 draft class is focusing on the wide receivers . it's a great group for many fans . there's one question for 13 second-year receivers, based on rookie usage and output . london's marvin Harrison has the most to prove among first-year wide receiver .

title: 10 moves that shaped the WNBA offseason -- and what they mean for 2025
content: the 2025 WNBA season tips off later this week, but first, let's look at how we got here . the golden state Valkyries join the league as the first expansion franchise since 2008 . three no. 1 picks who had spent the entirety of their careers with the franchises that drafted them .

title: 'My face, my rules': How FSU's Michaela Edenfield made makeup her competitive advantage
content: Michaela Edenfield is an artist at work, recording and sharing "get ready with me" videos . the 6-foot-1 redshirt senior is FSU's starting catcher . "it's the mental preparation behind closed doors," she says .

title: NBA playoff takeaways: Celtics hold off Knicks, force Game 6
content: no. 2 seed Boston Celtics held off the no. 3 seed New York Knicks in Game 5 on Wednesday night . Oklahoma City Thunder took a 3-1 series lead against the No. 4 seed Denver Nuggets .

content: if long overdue, reversal of policy, first reported by ESPN's Don Van Natta Jr. . manfred lifted bans on all deceased players, including Pete Rose and "Shoeless" Joe Jackson . most died decades ago and were on the list for gambling-related offenses .

title: The 100 most impactful transfers for the 2025 college football season

title: NFL schedules are out! See all 32, plus our bold predictions and reactions
content: the 2025 NFL schedule was released Wednesday night . the new york Giants have the toughest schedule of the season and the San Francisco 49ers have the easiest . they will kick off the season on friday, sept. 4, when they host the rival Dallas Cowboys .

title: Warriors offseason guide: How to build around Steph, Draymond and Jimmy

title: 2026 recruiting class rankings: Miami makes move after landing five-star OT
content: the recruiting trail is starting to heat up, in anticipation of being set ablaze in June . several five-stars have come off the board recently, including two of the top linemen in the nation . former Miami offensive lineman and current hurricanes coach Mario Cristobal scored a key win in the trenches for his Hurricanes .
